pr_title: Fix ReadOnlyWagedRebalancer so that it computes mapping from scratch

timeline.message:
Fix ReadOnlyWagedRebalancer so that it computes mapping from scratch

Previously, ReadOnlyWagedRebalancer would only read from the previously computed best possible mapping and returns it. This commit changes it so that it computes things from scratch - it can read the previously computed best possible mapping but shouldn't just return it without doing any calculation.
Fix util so that global rebalance happens synchronously

timeline.bodyText:
Let's have a different name for this private class. I would still prefer the old name DryrunWagedRebalancer.
But feel free to have a better name for this method.
timeline.author: jiajunwang

timeline.bodyText: As we see in the test, the current way overriding the live instance info won't work. We need to retain the session Id somehow. Otherwise, the current state won't be read correctly.
timeline.author: jiajunwang

timeline.bodyText:
I should have made myself clearer. What I meant to say is that you can name the newly defined private class DryrunWagedRebalancer here. But the one in the package org.apache.helix.controller.rebalancer.waged can still be named ReadOnlyWagedRebalancer.
The purpose is to differentiate the names so as to avoid confusion.
timeline.author: jiajunwang

timeline.bodyText:
Please don't filter out any live instances that are in the input but not in the dataProvider.
The caller might want to test with those non-exist live instances. And even the sessions of those non-exist live instances are empty, the tool can still running fine because there won't be any current state read for the non-exist instances anyway.
timeline.author: jiajunwang
